title: When a protagonist struggles to get what he wants, what is this called? - Quora

response.answer_text: The protagonist is engaged in the process of setting and achieving a goal. The goal and how he goes about achieving it is what determines his morality. If he has a productive goal and achieves it in an ethical, virtuous way, he is the hero. If he goes about attaining it in a unethical manner lacking virtue then he is the villain. Ayn Rand wrote: “Art is man’s metaphysical mirror; what a rational man seeks to see in that mirror is a salute; what an irrational man seeks to see is a justification—even if only a justification of his depravity, as a last convulsion of his betrayed self-esteem.”
A journey? That's how I see a protagonists story, it's simply a journey. Some journeys are tumultuous and others aren't. A protagonists struggle against an antagonist is called a conflict.
